au.com.innodev.wmboost.data

Interface ItemEntry<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - type to treat the entry value as
    All Superinterfaces:
    BaseUnitEntry, HasKey
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    NestedDocEntry, StringEntry

    public interface ItemEntry<T>
extends BaseUnitEntry
    A reference to a unit entry where the value is a single item. Allows access and modification of the entry identified by the key.

    It's suitable when an entry's value corresponds to a single item, such as a string. In contrast, a CollectionEntry is used for an entry that contains a collection of values, such as a string list.

    Retrieving a Value

    The get methods allow retrieving an entry's value. A value of type T is returned. If the original value is of type T, it is returned directly and the consuming code doesn't need to cast it. If the type is different, a conversion is attempted. For example, you may use an integer entry to retrieve an integer from a entry originally containing a string.

    The following getters are available:

    • getVal(): use it when you expect the entry to exist
    • getNonNullVal(): use it when you expect the entry to exist and for its value to be non-null
    • getValOrNull() and getValOrDefault(Object) (and the overloaded variations): use them when you don't know if the entry exists and want to return the default value if it doesn't. The limitation of these methods is the inability to differentiate between cases when the entry exists and cases when it doesn't.

    When you want to optionally retrieve values, you may use a combination of isAssigned() and getVal(). For example, the following code is a snippet of a transformer that takes a string and returns a lower-case version. If the string is not provided, the pipeline is not modified. If the value is null, null is returned: 

     public void toLower(IData pipeline) throws ServiceException {
        Document pipeDoc = Documents.wrap(pipeline);
        StringEntry originalEntry = pipeDoc.stringEntry("original");
        if (originalEntry.isAssigned()) {
                String originalString = originalEntry.getVal();
                String lowerString = (originalString != null) ? originalString.toLowerCase() : null;
                pipeDoc.stringEntry("lower").put(lowerString);
        }
 
 }

    Note that in the example getVal may be invoked without it failing because the isAssigned check already confirmed the entry's existence.

    Setting a Value

    Use one of the put methods to set the entry's value. If an entry identified with the key doesn't exist, a value is created. Otherwise, the current entry's value is replaced with the new value.

    The following setters are available:

    • put(Object): used when you want the entry's value to be of type T and you provide a value of type T
    • putConverted(Object): used when you want the entry's value to be of type T but the value you provide is different. The provided value is converted to type T.

    Removing an Entry

    Invoke remove(). Note that the type T is not taken into account when removing an entry.

    For documents that contain more than one entry with the same key (which is not very common), only the first entry is removed.

    Other considerations

    An instance manipulates a unit entry, that is, the first entry identified by the key. This is the norm in most uses cases. In rare situations where multiple entries for a key may exist and processing is required for all of those entries, use of SplitEntry would be more appropriate.

    • Method Detail

      • getKey

        String getKey()
        Description copied from interface: HasKey
        Returns the key associated to the entry being referenced
        Specified by:
        getKey in interface HasKey
        Returns:
        key associated to the entry
        See Also:
        HasKey.getKey()

      • isAssigned

        boolean isAssigned()
        Description copied from interface: BaseUnitEntry
        Indicates whether there's an entry with the key.

        Note that this method doesn't take into account the type of the value in the key/value pair.

        The result is the same as invoking Document.containsKey(String) with the entry's key.

        Specified by:
        isAssigned in interface BaseUnitEntry
        Returns:
        true if an entry with the key exists; false, otherwise
        See Also:
        BaseUnitEntry.isAssigned()

      • getVal

        T getVal()
  throws InexistentEntryException
        Returns the value component of an existing entry.

        Use this method when you expect an entry with the key to exist.

        If an entry with the key doesn't exist, an exception is thrown.

        Returns:
        entry value, possibly null
        Throws:
        InexistentEntryException - if there's no entry associated with the key

      • getNonNullVal

        T getNonNullVal()
         throws InexistentEntryException,
                UnexpectedEntryValueException
        Returns the non-null value component of an existing entry.

        Use this method when you expect an entry with the key to exist and also to have a non-null value.

        If an entry with the key doesn't exist or if it contains a null value, an exception is thrown.

        Returns:
        entry value, never null
        Throws:
        InexistentEntryException - if there's no entry associated with the key
        UnexpectedEntryValueException - if the entry contains a null value
        See Also:
        getVal()

      • getValOrNull

        T getValOrNull()
        Returns the value component of the key/value entry in the document.

        Use this method when you don't know if the entry exists and you don't want to distinguish between the case when the key is not assigned to an entry and the case when the value is null.

        This method is equivalent to getValOrNull(NullValHandling) with NullValHandling set to NullValHandling.RETURN_DEFAULT.

        Returns:
        entry value or null if entry doesn't exist
        See Also:
        getValOrNull(NullValHandling)

      • getValOrNull

        T getValOrNull(NullValHandling nullValHandling)
        throws UnexpectedEntryValueException
        Returns the value component of the key/value entry in the document. If the entry doesn't exist or the entry value is null, the provided default value is returned.

        Use this method when you don't know if the entry exists and you don't want to distinguish between the case when the key is not assigned to an entry and the case when the value is null.

        Parameters:
        nullValHandling - behaviour when entry contains a null value
        Returns:
        entry value or null if entry doesn't exist
        Throws:
        UnexpectedEntryValueException - when the entry value is null and NullValHandling.FAIL is used
        See Also:
        getVal()

      • getValOrDefault

        T getValOrDefault(T defaultValue)
        Returns the value component of the key/value entry in the document. If the entry doesn't exist or the entry value is null, the provided default value is returned.

        Use this method when you don't know if the entry exists and you want defaultValue to be returned if it doesn't.

        This method is equivalent to getValOrDefault(Object, NullValHandling) with NullValHandling set to NullValHandling.RETURN_DEFAULT.

        Parameters:
        defaultValue - value to return if entry doesn't exist
        Returns:
        entry value or defaultValue if entry doesn't exist
        See Also:
        getValOrDefault(Object, NullValHandling)

      • getValOrDefault

        T getValOrDefault(T defaultValue,
                  NullValHandling nullValHandling)
           throws UnexpectedEntryValueException
        Returns the value component of the key/value entry in the document.

        Use this method when you don't know if the entry exists and you want defaultValue to be returned if it doesn't.

        Parameters:
        defaultValue - value to return if entry doesn't exist
        nullValHandling - behaviour when entry contains a null value
        Returns:
        entry value or defaultValue if entry doesn't exist
        Throws:
        UnexpectedEntryValueException - when the entry value is null and NullValHandling.FAIL is used.
        See Also:
        getVal()

      • put

        void put(T value)
        Sets the provided value as the entry's value.

        If an entry identified with the key doesn't exist, a value is created. Otherwise, the entry's value is replaced with the provided value.

        Parameters:
        value - the new value to set for the entry

      • putConverted

        void putConverted(Object value)
        Converts the provided value and sets the converted value as the entry's value.

        Use this method in cases where the value type is different to the type you want to be stored in the entry. For example, if you wanted an Integer value of 5 to be stored as a String in the entry, you could use the following code: 

         doc.stringEntry("total").putConverted(5);

        If the provided value can't be converted to the entry's type, an exception is thrown.

        Parameters:
        value - the new value to set for the entry
        See Also:
        put(Object)

      • remove

        void remove()
     throws InexistentEntryException
        Deletes the entry in strict mode.
        Throws:
        InexistentEntryException
        See Also:
        remove(RemoveEntryOption)

      • remove

        void remove(RemoveEntryOption removeOption)
     throws InexistentEntryException
        Deletes the entry identified by the element’s key.

        Note that type used for the entry (e.g. String) is not considered when removing the entry. It's only done by key.

        Because this is a unit entry reference, if multiple elements exist in the document for the given key, only the first entry is deleted.

        Parameters:
        removeOption - strict or lenient removal option
        Throws:
        InexistentEntryException
